venue.address_2: Across from the Park Street MBTA Station
venue.name: Finagle a Bagel by Park Street Station

item.description:
Let's learn some more about our nation's history while getting in a great walk!

The Freedom Trail in Boston is 2-1/2 miles long and has several historic sites along the route, marked by a red painted line on the sidewalk so it's easy to follow. Each of the sites along the way is important in America's Revolutionary era history, some of which include The Boston Common, The State House, Park Street Church, Granary Burying Ground, Old South Meeting House, Site of the Boston Massacre, Faneuil Hall, Paul Revere House, Old North Church, Bunker Hill Monument and the USS Constitution.

We will meet at the Finagle-A-Bagel just outside Park St. Station on the MBTA Red Line. Our walk will be about 3-1/2 miles total. We will finish at North Station on the MBTA Green line which will take us back to Park Street (and further south) on the MBTA Red line.

Please dress accordingly for the weather, wear comfortable shoes, and consider bringing a camera.

group.name: The South Shore Fitness Meetup Group

item.name: Walking the Freedom Trail
